DOCNAME: CASE OF FRANZ MAIER GMBH v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
JUDGES: Egidijus Kūris;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Gabriele Kucsko-Stadlmayer
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company is a limited liability company with its seat in Bad PERSON , producing building materials of concrete and using crushed stones ( Schotter ) for this purpose .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company requested ORG ( PERSON ) to issue a licence under LAW ( wasserrechtliche GPE ) for dredging ( GPE ) on its plot .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to issue the licence for dredging and imposed certain conditions .
CARDINAL . On DATE TIME , the owner of the NORP mineral water spring appealed against this decision , claiming that the dredging had a negative impact on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG für Land- PERSON , PERSON ) ( “ the Ministry ” ) ordered the applicant company to submit a plan of the projected dredging area and of all the springs and wells concerned .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted some plans but stated that it had no knowledge about the location of the spring and PERSON refused to provide the necessary information .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted further plans to the authorities .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG served an expert opinion on the applicant company . According to this expert opinion the information submitted by the applicant company was not sufficient to prove that there was no negative impact of dredging on the springs . The applicant company was requested to comment hereon .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of ORG and remitted it back to the first instance authority on the grounds that the applicant company had failed to provide sufficient information in order to assess a possible negative impact on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant company to submit the missing documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted a private expert opinion to the Regional Governor .
CARDINAL . On DATE an oral hearing was held .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Governor again issued the requested licence for dredging and imposed certain conditions .
CARDINAL . On DATE H.P. , the Bad GPE municipality and the Bad GPE DATE company appealed against this decision to the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted written comments to the Ministry .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company complained to ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) about the administration ’s failure to decide ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the Ministry to decide within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG transmitted another expert ’s opinion to the parties and requested the applicant company to submit the missing documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry requested ORG to extend the deadline for the decision to DATE as the proceedings were not finalised .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company commented on the recently obtained expert opinion ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) claiming , inter alia , that the Ministry failed to determine which missing documents were to be submitted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prolonged the deadline for ORG until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted another private expert opinion to the Ministry .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry rejected the requested dredging licence on the grounds that the applicant company had failed to submit all the requested documents .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG closed the proceedings on the applicant company ’s complaint about the administration ’s failure to decide ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and ordered the reimbursement of the costs related to this complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked ORG and the other parties to submit written observations within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE TIME , the Bad NORP municipality and the Bad GPE DATE company submitted their written observations .
CARDINAL . The ORG submitted written observations which were served on the applicant company on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company put forward further submissions in reply to the ORG ’s observations ; PERSON , the Bad GPE municipality and the Bad GPE DATE company replied hereto on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision by ORG as it was not clarified which documents the applicant company had to submit .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted CARDINAL other private expert opinions to ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant company lodged another application against the administration ’s failure to decide with ORG .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG ordered the Ministry to decide within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG submitted another expert opinion to the parties and asked the applicant company to submit certain precisely mentioned documents within DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company referred to the already submitted private expert opinions and claimed that the mentioned documents were not necessary . In addition , it requested to appoint another expert . Nonetheless , it submitted a supplementary expert opinion .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended to DATE the deadline for ORG to decide .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry requested the Bad GPE municipality and the Bad GPE DATE company ( PERSON appeal had meanwhile been considered to be withdrawn ) to submit written observations on the documents recently transmitted by the applicant company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Bad NORP municipality and the Bad GPE DATE company submitted their written observations , to which the applicant company replied on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company submitted another private expert opinion to the Ministry in compliance with the ORG ’s request of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry communicated a further expert opinion for the applicant company ’s information .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry dismissed the appeals and therefore permitted the requested dredging by the applicant company . This decision , served on the applicant company on DATE , became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG closed the proceedings on the applicant company ’s second complaint about the administration ’s failure to decide ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and ordered the reimbursement of the costs related to this complaint .
